quest.name: The Sleeping Gentleman
journal: The pungent Lalafell can scarcely conceal his excitement.

Strolling through the streets of Radz–at–Han, you encounter a strangely familiar Lalafell. He proudly identifies himself as the selfsame youth you met once upon a time in Kugane...who happens to have an unhealthy obsession with Nashu Mhakaracca. It seems the apple of his eye has once again found herself in a pickle, and is greatly distressed by the condition of one Hildibrand─agent of enquiry, inspector extraordinaire. Curious as to what fate has befallen the redoubtable gentleman─you make for the High Crucible to learn more.

Following events in the Far East in which Nashu and Hildibrand were sucked into a foreboding portal─along with Gilgamesh, notorious weapon thief, and Jubraca, an unscrupulous Hannish merchant─your associates found themselves wandering the “Interspectorial Rift” for a time. Eventually, with the aid of a recovered Gilgamesh, the other three managed to return to the Source. However, while Nashu was none the worse for wear, Hildibrand emerged in a comatose state for reasons yet unknown. The inspector's plucky assistant has attempted to fashion medicines to revive him, but to no avail. Hoping you might have some insight into his condition, she invites you to join her in Kama at the residence where the inspector is convalescing.

Examining the unconscious body of Hildibrand, you conclude that, like the Scions before him, his soul has been summoned to another world─likely the First. Nashu, understandably, is not quite able to grasp the situation, but she is nevertheless heartened that you might be able to bring him back. Entrusting you with her homemade explosives should you have need of them, she bids you a safe journey, and you prepare to depart for the Crystarium. With luck, you will track down the gentleman inspector's wandering spirit.

You pay a visit to the Wandering Stairs, where Glynard informs you that one of the veteran bounty hunters mentioned a suspicious individual wont to strike unseemly poses. After listening to the account of said bounty hunter, the dwarf Giott, you are all but convinced that the man in question is none other than Inspector Hildibrand. You are subsequently approached by the former guardsmen Theyler and Vonard, who coincidentally enough are also on the trail of the infamous poser. United by a common goal, you and your comrades depart for Sullen, where the man was last spotted.

While the various witnesses in Sullen offer conflicting reports, the picture they paint of the mystery man is one which suggests that, despite his ghastly appearance and disturbing poses, he is a gentlemanly soul at heart. With no doubt remaining that you are on the inspector's trail, you go to share your findings with Theyler and Vonard.

Theyler and Vonard are pleased to hear of your success, and somewhat relieved that the poser has proved relatively benign thus far. The three of you resolve to scour the Forest of the Lost Shepherd, where the eyewitnesses claim to have encountered your quarry.

Sure enough, you soon come upon a Hildibrand seemingly bereft of his memories and looking a bit pale in the face. Fortunately, a judicious application of Nashu's Delight is enough to make the inspector remember who he is. In that instant, you and your companions are granted a vision by the Echo, which reveals in ludicrous detail how a chance encounter with Giott led Hildibrand to believe he was a Lightwarden extraordinaire. In any event, having been disabused of such notions, Hildibrand strikes his trademark pose and announces his triumphant return to his adoring fans.
objectives: Speak with Glynard at the Crystarium.

dialogue.name: OKKAKE
dialogue.text: Wait, I know you! We met in Kugane! You're that stone-cold killer I asked to look after the love of my life!

dialogue.name: OKKAKE
dialogue.text: What's that look for? Surely you haven't forgotten me. You and me, we had a moment─a connection! Not like the one I've got with her, of course, but I know I left an impression!

dialogue.name: Q4
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A4
dialogue.text: ...The creepy little bastard who smells like cheese and followed Nashu to Kugane after stalking her for over five years?

dialogue.name: A4
dialogue.text: Frankly, considering how many blows to the head I've taken, I'm lucky I haven't forgotten my own name.

dialogue.name: OKKAKE
dialogue.text: Hey! There's nothing creepy about my love! It's as pure as the pristine waters of a forest stream! <sniff> <sniff> ...Fair point about the cheese stink, though.

dialogue.name: OKKAKE
dialogue.text: Head trauma notwithstanding, I'm still offended! At the very least, surely my love for my sultry muse─my innocent and pure and not-at-all creepy adoration for the totality of her existence─is the kind of thing that would stick in your memory!

dialogue.name: OKKAKE
dialogue.text: But enough about me─this is about Miss Nashu!

dialogue.name: OKKAKE
dialogue.text: Ever since she got sucked into that weird portal back east, I've been scouring the world for any sign of her. I was this close to giving up, but then, huzzah! I found her here in Radz–at–Han!

dialogue.name: OKKAKE
dialogue.text: Normally I'd be happy to get back to playing the silent invisible guardian, but she seems pretty distressed by the plight of her inspector friend. He's here too, but laid up and showing no signs of waking any time soon. My Nashu has been fashioning all sorts of medicines in hopes of rousing him, but to no avail.

dialogue.name: OKKAKE
dialogue.text: I mean, I couldn't care less if he kicked the bucket, but I hate seeing her like this. She's liable to work herself to death!

dialogue.name: OKKAKE
dialogue.text: So, what say you? Will you deliver my dearest Nashu from her plight? You'll find her over at the High Crucible, no doubt slaving over an alembic.

dialogue.name: OKKAKE
dialogue.text: And with that, I'll get back to cheering her on from the shadows! You too, I guess. Now go, quickly! Save my beloved!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: And that should do it! Now to take this medicine and...

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Cor! Forename! It feels like it's been forever! Though definitely less than a year, I'm sure.

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: What brings you to Radz–at–Han? Enjoying a spot of adventuring, or perhaps...

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Then you've heard! It's true. Inspector Hildibrand's gone into hibernation again, and─ Ah, wait. You're giving me that look. The one that screams, “What about the whole weird portal business?” All right, since you silently asked...

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: So, back on the Ruby Sea─remember how Greg got doused with dewprism and was forced to whisk us all “far away”?

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: ...How that strange rift then opened up─which the inspector then got sucked up into─and how I followed him in after that?

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Well, after that, we all ended up in this bizarre place. Couldn't tell up from down, left from right. And so we wandered, lost and confused...

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Fortunately, Greg came to his senses and explained that we were in the “Interspectorial Rift,” and then used the same trick to bring us home!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Greg himself stayed behind, though. Something about a score that he had to settle. Not sure what that was about, but hey, you know Greg...

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Anyway, we're back now, but the rub is that Inspector Hildibrand hasn't opened his eyes once!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: I know he needs his beauty sleep, but it's been an awfully long time, and we've got cases to solve!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: I've been trying my hand at apothecary stuff, seeing if I can't make something that'll get him up and moving, but nothing seems to work!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: But I think we're making progress. Me and Mister Chupacabra from the Shakshouka Concern, that is. You remember Mister Chupacabra, right? Got sucked into the rift along with us, former evil mastermind─not so bad once you get to know him.

dialogue.name: RADZATHANMERCHANT03168
dialogue.text: Pleased I am to meet you once more, and under less compromising circumstances. If I may correct our mutual friend─I am Jubraca, chairman of the Sahjattra Concern.

dialogue.name: RADZATHANMERCHANT03168
dialogue.text: Y-Your distrustful and somewhat bloodthirsty glare is not unwarranted, but in my defense, who among us has not contemplated enslaving the rich and powerful to bend the world to their whim...? Hah hah...hah... Ahem.

dialogue.name: RADZATHANMERCHANT03168
dialogue.text: I pray you forgive me my poor joke, and allow me to assure you that after wandering the interdimensional rift for the-Sisters-only-know-how long, I am a changed man!

dialogue.name: RADZATHANMERCHANT03168
dialogue.text: Naturally, I understand that words alone would not suffice to absolve me of my sins. Thus, since my return, I have operated a humble apothecary that caters to the needs of one and all.

dialogue.name: RADZATHANMERCHANT03168
dialogue.text: Furthermore, I made arrangements for Miss Nashu's workshop. Rest assured that I will spare no effort in helping her see Inspector Hildibrand awakened and returned to full health.

dialogue.name: RADZATHANMERCHANT03168
dialogue.text: And with that, if you would excuse me, I must see to other business...

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Isn't he the nicest ex-villain you've ever met? Ah, but that's right─I had just finished my latest medicine! I've got high hopes for this new recipe.

dialogue.name: Q5
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A5
dialogue.text: I suppose I ought to get a look at the Manderville man himself.

dialogue.name: A5
dialogue.text: Medicine might not do us any good...

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: By all means! The inspector is resting in a room up in Kama. Awake or asleep, I'm sure he'd enjoy your company. Let's go!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Really? Well, you've seen all kinds of amazing things in your travels, so maybe you'll be able to tell what's wrong with the inspector if you get a look at him yourself.

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: He's resting in a room up in Kama. Let's go!

dialogue.name: PARIGHA
dialogue.text: The girl's a friend of yours, is she? She's welcome to stay as long as she likes. I do hope her friend recovers soon, though. Sleeping on the floor hasn't been good for my back...

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Isn't this room nice? Mister Chupacabra's taken care of everything─even paid the rent in full! Ah, but I'm distracting you, aren't I? You need to concentrate while you examine the inspector, yes?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Study the sleeping Inspector Hildibrand. You may move the camera, as well as zoom in and out. Target a section and examine it in more detail with [???] / [???].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The inspector's condition is disturbingly reminiscent of the Scions' who were summoned to the First for a time...

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Hmm...? Oh! Finished already?

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Any theories as to what's wrong with the inspector?

dialogue.name: Q6
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A6
dialogue.text: Well, he's a soulless husk, which is less than ideal.

dialogue.name: A6
dialogue.text: I suspect he may have been summoned to another reflection.

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: I see... I mean, I don't, but that's what you're supposed to say at times like this, I know that much. How do we wake him up?

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Return his soul to his body? But where did it go, and what is it doing there?

dialogue.name: Q9
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A9
dialogue.text: Probably went to the First to become the Gentleman of Darkness, as you do.

dialogue.name: A9
dialogue.text: I think it's gone to another world wholly unlike ours...but still slightly like ours. A world of contrasts.

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: I see... Right. So can you go...there?

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Great! In that case, I'll leave the soul searching to you!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: I'm sure it goes without saying, but once you've arrived in this otherworldly world, look for a place that smells of mystery and intrigue, and chat with people there. That's standard agent of enquiry protocol!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Oh, and since this is Inspector Hildibrand we're talking about...don't be surprised if you find him asleep, or having forgotten a thing or two.

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: But not to worry! I've prepared my traditional “medicine” just in case. Don't hesitate to use it! And with that, do take care out there!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: When in doubt, use Nashu's Delights to blow the cobwebs right out! The inspector will thank you after, I'm sure.

dialogue.name: GLYNARD
dialogue.text: Welcome back, friend. I'd offer you a pint, but my barman's sense tells me that's not why you're here...

dialogue.name: GLYNARD
dialogue.text: So this friend of yours has gone missing? Sorry to hear that, but plenty of travelers pass through these parts. Could you describe the fellow to me?

dialogue.name: Q7
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A7
dialogue.text: Hume, burly, wears a monocle, well-meaning idiot.

dialogue.name: A7
dialogue.text: He was wearing a tattered suit, most like.

dialogue.name: GLYNARD
dialogue.text: Hmmm...yes, that sounds familiar. Mind you, I didn't see him myself─but I do believe one of our bounty hunters spied such a man when you were all battling that horde of spectral warriors.

dialogue.name: GLYNARD
dialogue.text: Giott! Come here a moment. There's someone who wants to speak with you!

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: <gulp> That so? Make it─<hic>─quick. Thish ale ishn't going to drink itshelf...

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: If it ain't Forename! What brings you back to our neck of the woods?

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: Who're─ Wait. You're one of the Exarch's friends─the Warrior of Darkness! Fought by your side when the glowing bastards came to ruin our day─but we showed them, hah! But enough reminiscing─what's so important that you had to interrupt my regularly scheduled drinking?

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: Now that you mention it, I did see someone like that. Back there on the battlefield, after you ran off to do more hero work.

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: At first, I thought he was going to attack me like the rest of the spirit wotsits. But no, he just stood there, striking a pose, trying to scare or seduce me. Damned if I could tell.

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: Still, he was glowing, and I wasn't about to take any chances, so I said, “Hey! Piss off, ghost!” and sent him packing.

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: "Did he die,“ you ask? To which I say, ”What am I, a chirurgeon?“ Also, ”I've kept my mug waiting long enough.“ Good talk.

dialogue.name: SOLDIER03608
dialogue.text: (-???-)Could it be!? The Warrior of Darkness!

dialogue.name: SOLDIER03608
dialogue.text: I thought that was your voice, but was convinced my ears were playing tricks on me. It's good to see you again.

dialogue.name: BRAVESOLDIER
dialogue.text: Didn't mean to eavesdrop, but we overheard you discussing the renegade poser. We've been searching for him for some time now.

dialogue.name: SOLDIER03608
dialogue.text: There have been sightings in Lakeland, you see. Vonard and I have been tasked with getting to the bottom of it.

dialogue.name: SOLDIER03608
dialogue.text: We've little in the way of useful information, though. All we know is that he appears without warning and strikes a disturbing pose.

dialogue.name: BRAVESOLDIER
dialogue.text: He's not caused any harm─if you discount the shock of a strange man gesticulating in your general direction, that is. Nevertheless, we're worried his behavior might escalate. Have you been tasked with apprehending the miscreant as well?

dialogue.name: GLYNARD
dialogue.text: Not quite, Vonard. Forename's come back to track down a missing friend.

dialogue.name: Q8
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A8
dialogue.text: Your “miscreant,” I regret to say, might be my friend...

dialogue.name: A8
dialogue.text: I wouldn't call him a “friend” per se, but I too happen to be looking for a man prone to posing.

dialogue.name: GLYNARD
dialogue.text: Hmm. If the man you're looking for might be one and the same, then why not work together? Between the three of you, you're bound to have better luck.

dialogue.name: SOLDIER03608
dialogue.text: It would be an honor─and a great help! We were just about to leave to gather testimony, as it happens.

dialogue.name: BRAVESOLDIER
dialogue.text: Come and join us in Sullen when you've finished here. We'll solve this mystery in no time!

dialogue.name: GLYNARD
dialogue.text: You always kept interesting company, that's for sure. I don't know if it would be better or worse if this “poser” is your friend, but I wish you the best of luck.

dialogue.name: SOLDIER03608
dialogue.text: Searching for this man might seem like a waste of time to some, but it's our duty to ease the people's worries─large or small.

dialogue.name: BRAVESOLDIER
dialogue.text: Maybe we're worrying over nothing if he's not hurt anyone yet, but you never know with some people. Better safe than sorry.

dialogue.name: SULLENA04542
dialogue.text: Did I see him? You bet I did. I was crossing through the Forest of the Lost Shepherd, on my way to deliver fish to the Ostall Imperative...

dialogue.name: SULLENA04542
dialogue.text: Out of nowhere, this odd man leapt in front of me! I thought he was a bandit at first, but then he abruptly turned to the side, curled his neck, and put his fist to his head as if to say...I don't know. It was baffling. I ran when I realized he wasn't going to do anything else.

dialogue.name: SULLENB04542
dialogue.text: ...Why, yes─I saw someone like that when I was out picking mushrooms in the forest. He even spoke to me!

dialogue.name: SULLENB04542
dialogue.text: I was repulsed at first by his form, but he only wanted to warn me that fell beasts lurk in the forest, and that I should be wary.

dialogue.name: SULLENB04542
dialogue.text: Contrary to appearances, I'd say he was actually quite...gentlemanly.

dialogue.name: SULLENC04542
dialogue.text: Oh, that fellow? Aye, I saw 'im the other day on the way home from Clearmelt. I'd enjoyed one too many libations after my bath, and ended up wanderin' off into the forest.

dialogue.name: SULLENC04542
dialogue.text: Before I knew it, the sun was dippin' low, and the sky turnin' dark, and I was beginnin' to wonder if I'd ever make it home. Then I felt a gentle tug at my arm.

dialogue.name: SULLENC04542
dialogue.text: And would you believe it? This odd-lookin' man led me out of the forest and set me back on the road! I thanked him profusely, but he said nothin' in reply, just struck this pose and walked off.

dialogue.name: SULLENA04542
dialogue.text: I do hope you find that strange man. He may just be a nuisance for now, but we shouldn't have to suffer posing vagabonds.

dialogue.name: SULLENB04542
dialogue.text: He may look scary, but he's quite the gentleman. Why else would he have warned me about the monsters?

dialogue.name: SULLENC04542
dialogue.text: If you see the fellow, tell him to come and visit. I owe him a drink or two for his kindness.

dialogue.name: BRAVESOLDIER
dialogue.text: To be honest, I'm not sure what to make of all this...

dialogue.name: SOLDIER03608
dialogue.text: Finished questioning the locals, have you? Were you able to learn anything?

dialogue.name: SOLDIER03608
dialogue.text: ...Not only has the poser caused no harm, he's even helped people?

dialogue.name: BRAVESOLDIER
dialogue.text: So he's a gentleman, albeit a suspicious one. Something of a contradiction you might say, but there's no reason to doubt what we heard.

dialogue.name: SOLDIER03608
dialogue.text: Everyone seemed to encounter him in the Forest of the Lost Shepherd, right? Then that's where we'll look next. Shall we?

dialogue.name: BRAVESOLDIER
dialogue.text: On the other hand, some folks might argue a suspicious gentleman is more dangerous than a man more blatant in his villainy. This “gentlemanliness” could well be a ruse to mask all kinds of evil intentions.

dialogue.name: SOLDIER03608
dialogue.text: Well, here we are. But how exactly are we supposed to begin our search? These woods are, well...woods.

dialogue.name: BRAVESOLDIER
dialogue.text: Got a plan, do you? Far be it from me to doubt the Warrior of Darkness. Show us what you've got in mind, and we'll back you up to the best of our ability.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Perform the Manderville.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Perform the Manderville Mambo.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: (-Familiar Voice-)Hark! What familiar gentlemanly gyrations are these!?

dialogue.name: BRAVESOLDIER
dialogue.text: On your guard! It's a sin eater!

dialogue.name: SOLDIER03608
dialogue.text: No, wait! That's no sin eater!

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: It's Hildibrand!

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: It's the Gentleman of Light!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: (-Forgiven Gentleman-)Hildibrand? Who is this Hildibrand of whom you speak? I am the Forgiven Gentleman, devourer of sins! Lightwarden extraordinaire!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: (-Forgiven Gentleman-)Gentleman of Light? Who is this Gentleman of Light of whom you speak? I am the Forgiven Gentleman, devourer of sins! Lightwarden extraordinaire!

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: You're not a sin eater─you're Hildibrand, the gentleman inspector!

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: You might occasionally moonlight as a zombie overlord, but trust me, you're a gentleman inspector!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: (-Forgiven Gentleman-)Urrrgggh... Hurrrggghhh...! Inspector... Sin eater... Inspector... Sin eater...

dialogue.name: SOLDIER03608
dialogue.text: You're acquainted with this, er...gentleman?

dialogue.name: SOLDIER03608
dialogue.text: ...Right, then. Clearly, your friend has been through a lot. But still, how did he get it in his head he's a sin eater?

dialogue.name: BRAVESOLDIER
dialogue.text: Is there no way to bring back his memories?

dialogue.name: BRAVESOLDIER
dialogue.text: Explosives? We're still trying to save him, right?

dialogue.name: SOLDIER03608
dialogue.text: Wicked white, we've killed him!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: I say, Forename! I had resigned myself to Nashu's ungentle methodology, but you too, my brutish friend!?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: But never mind that. I do not recall the world being quite so purple...

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Previously, I was with Nashu and Greg, wandering the bizarre, shadowy realm known as the “Interspectorial Rift”...

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Hmm? Where am I...? Who am I?

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: That sickening light. That aggressive posturing. I know what you are. You're one of them, ain't you?

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: What you need is a good old-fashioned dwarven decking!

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: Piss off, ghost!

dialogue.name: SULLENRESIDENT
dialogue.text: R-Run for your lives! It's a sin eater!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: A sin...eater?

dialogue.name: BRAVESOLDIER
dialogue.text: I'll be damned. I saw a vision of the man's past. No wonder he became convinced he was a sin eater.

dialogue.name: SOLDIER03608
dialogue.text: I saw it too. It was, quite possibly, the most ridiculous memory I've ever glimpsed...

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Answer me, my faithful assistant! Where are we─and why is it so purple!?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: ...The “First”? The first what? Are you telling me we've somehow traveled to an entirely different world?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Good gods! To think that I have transcended the very boundaries of time and space! But worry not, my adoring fans! Hildibrand─agent of enquiry, inspector extraordinaire─will return to you forthwith!
